com.wx.fx.gui.window

Class StageManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.wx.fx.gui.window.StageManager

  • public class StageManager
extends java.lang.Object
    This class allows to manage the stages of the application. It facilitates the loading of the stage and allows to pass arguments to shown stages.

    Usage

    To make use of this manager, for a given stage:
    • Ensure that the stage's controller class implements StageController
    • Create a StageInfo instance describing the stage
    • Show or close the stage simply by passing the StageInfo to show(StageInfo, Object...) or close(StageInfo)
    Notice that a StageInfo represents a unique stage. If a stage should be displayed in several instances, then it should be represented by several StageInfo.

    Stage groups

    Every stage has a group number. Then, the manager ensures a basic rule: every group can only have one visible stage at any time. For instance, if stage A is visible and stage B (of the same group) is set visible, then, stage A is hidden (not closed) and B is shown instead. If B is closed, then A is shown again.

    If stages have different group numbers, they won't interfere between them.

    Also, if a stage has a negative group number, it won't belong to any group (and thus, won't affect or be affected by any other stage).

    Created on 08/07/2015
